title: How to find books that advise on how to approach different businesses and suggest steps for a starting entrepreneur to take  - Quora

response.answer_text: The first thing you need to do is take a deep look at yourself and think about what kind of an entrepreneur you want to be:  Historically, roughly 80% of entrepreneurs choose the path on the left. For that type of business, the best book for a starting entrepreneur is: Small Time Operator: How to Start Your Own Business, Keep Your Books, Pay Your Taxes, and Stay Out of Trouble  For the 20% taking the “go big or go home” bet (where realistically they will either get funded by angels or VCs, or else go out of business in a few years), the best book for a starting entrepreneur is [he says confidently, since he wrote it]: The Startup Checklist: 25 Steps to a Scalable, High-Growth Business  While many (if not most) of the basic business concepts are the same, the legal and structural details are quite different between the two paths, so it's really important to figure out where you want to end up before you start.

There are lots of books available for a starting entrepreneur, for instance Entrepreneurship For Dummies: Kathleen Allen: 0785555030633: Amazon.com: Books or Small Business For Dummies: Eric Tyson, Jim Schell: 9781118083727: Amazon.com: Books but I think one of the best sources is online at Small Business Administration site. I also highly recommend writing a business plan. You’ll find free templates on the web. As for approaching/contacting business, it will depend on the nature & size of the business and what you offer. You’ll contact Microsoft much differently than you’ll contact me. Personally, I loathe cold calls (phone or visits) & prefer email with a scheduled personal appointment, if necessary.

Quora is a good place to ask this question. I’d do a small self promo and add my book to the list. It’s a short playbook about how to start your own startup from scratch. It’s available on Amazon and the Kindle version is $1.19.
If u go to a library they have a large collection if books. Entrepreneur centers are good places to start as well. If you stated what business you were interested in there are more resources.
